speaker.whotheyare: Nobel Laureate Al Gore continues to focus the world's attention on the global climate crisis.
speaker.whylisten:
Former Vice President Al Gore is the co-founder and chairman of Generation Investment Management and the founder and chairman of The Climate Reality Project, a nonprofit devoted to solving the climate crisis. He is also a senior partner at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers and on the board of directors at Apple. The focus of the 2006 Oscar-winning documentary An Inconvenient Truth, Gore is the author of numerous books on climate change and our collective future. He wrote the documentary An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power, released in 2017.

Gore was first elected to the US House of Representatives in 1976, to the US Senate in 1984 and vice president in 1992. In 2007, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, along with the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, for "informing the world of the dangers posed by climate change."
